contentrichtext.text: '''Baron Rugby''', of [[Rugby, Warwickshire|Rugby]] in the County of Warwick, is a title in the [[Peerage of the United Kingdom]]. It was created in 1947 for the civil servant [[John Maffey, 1st Baron Rugby|Sir John Maffey]]. He was [[Anglo-Egyptian Sudan|Governor-General of the Sudan]] between 1926 and 1933 and [[Under-Secretary of State for the Colonies|Permanent Under-Secretary of State for the Colonies]] between 1933 and 1937. At Winston Churchill's request he became the first United Kingdom representative to Ireland in 1939, a post he held throughout the war years and until his retirement in 1949. The title is now held by his grandson, the third Baron, who succeeded his father in 1990. The Hon. [[Penelope Aitken]], mother of the former [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative]] politician [[Jonathan Aitken]] and of the actress [[Maria Aitken]], was the daughter of the first Baron Rugby. ==Barons Rugby (1947)== *[[John Maffey, 1st Baron Rugby|John Loader Maffey, 1st Baron Rugby]] (1877–1969) *Alan Loader Maffey, 2nd Baron Rugby (1913–1990) *Robert Charles Maffey, 3rd Baron Rugby (b. 1951) The [[heir apparent]] to the barony is the 3rd Baron's eldest son, the Hon. Timothy James Howard Rugby (born 1975). ==Notes== {{unreferenced|date=February 2013}} {{reflist}} ==References== *Kidd, Charles, Williamson, David (editors). ''Debrett's Peerage and Baronetage'' (1990 edition). New York: St Martin's Press, 1990, {{Page needed |date=February 2013}} *{{Rayment|date=February 2012}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Rugby}} [[Category:Baronies in the Peerage of the United Kingdom]]
